info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 12 at 10:58PM EDT until May 13 at 4:45AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
info.description:
FFWGSP
The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Abbeville County in upstate South Carolina... Western Greenwood County in upstate South Carolina...
* Until 445 AM EDT.
* At 1058 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated training thunderstorms have been producing heavy rain across eastern Abbeville and western Greenwood counties. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen over the past 90 minutes, including over the cities of Abbeville and Greenwood. An additional 1-2 inches of rainfall is expected across the warned area, resulting in significant flash flooding. Several small streams are expected to quickly rise out of their banks and will be capable of producing Minor to Moderate flash flooding across the warned area, especially over the urban areas of Abbeville and Greenwood. Dangerous flash flooding of roadways and structures adjacent to streams may occur. Inundation of low-lying areas, including parks, greenways, and campgrounds may reach several feet deep! Seek higher ground now!
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Flooding may significantly inundate roadways and impact structures. Low-level first-floor elevations adjacent to streams may be flooded.
* Some locations that will experience Minor to Moderate flash flooding include... Greenwood, Abbeville, Ware Shoals, Cokesbury, Hodges, Troy, Promised Land, Bradley and Coronaca.
info.instruction:
Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.

parameter.value: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 4:45 AM EDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD WARNING is in effect for this area until 4:45 AM EDT. This is a dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: SNM: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 4:45 AM EDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: AVISO DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 4:45 AM EDT. Esta es una situacion peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
